desc: Students examine contemporary approaches to classical issues in ethics and theory of value: the nature of moral judgments; theories of moral obligation and value; the concept of moral responsibility; and the relation of morality to science, religion, and law. May be repeated if topics are different. Prerequisites: two courses in philosophy, one of which must be either 235 or 236, or permission of the department chair; completion of BTS-T.
name: Sem: Ethic & Value Theory
notes: Prerequisite: Completion of BTS-T requirement. See course description for additional prerequisites.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: two courses in philosophy, one of which must be either 235 or 236, or permission of the department chair; completion of BTS-T.
title: Studies in Ethics and Theory of Value
